meanings.definition: In a way that is pleasing to the taste or appetite.
meanings.sent2: She smiled toothsomely after tasting the sweet treat.
meanings.sent3: The cookies disappeared toothsomely fast at the party.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked bread filled the room toothsomely.
meanings.sent5: The soup was so toothsomely seasoned that everyone asked for seconds.

meanings.definition: In a way that is attractive or appealing.
meanings.sent1: The garden was toothsomely decorated with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: The model posed toothsomely for the camera.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail toothsomely at the sight of its owner.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky toothsomely with hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The shiny new car gleamed toothsomely under the sunlight.
